intro: Diplora integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leaved diplora, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, entire leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are usually pink or purple and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Diplora integrifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
